As Fernando reached the top of the mountain, the biting cold made his hands shake uncontrollably. He struggled to take the pictures he had envisioned, but the cold and his trembling hands made it impossible. The majestic Alps, usually a photographer's dream, were now a blurry mess.

Back at the supermarket, John was thrilled with his haul. He had gotten away with it, and his cart was filled with free goodies. Back at the park, Kelly carefully laid on her belly on the sled, her heart racing with excitement. She slowly pushed herself over the crest of the hill, and the sled quickly picked up speed as she glided down the hill. The wind whipped through her hair, and she laughed all the way to the bottom, the thrill of the ride coursing through her veins.

As Neil arrived at the Black Forest, he was struck by its eerie beauty. The trees towered above him, their branches creaking ominously in the wind. Despite the spookiness of the atmosphere, he couldn't help but be awed by the forest's majesty. He wandered through the trees, taking in the sights and sounds of this enchanting place.

As the sun began to set, Kelly made her way back up the hill, eager to do it all again. And Neil, his visit to Germany coming to a close, knew that he would never forget the beauty of the Black Forest, and the thrill of the sled ride that Kelly had experienced just hours before.

outline: Gina wanted a brand new desk like the new boy in her class.

responses:
Gina gazed longingly at the new boy's sleek, modern desk in class. She wanted one just like it. But every time she tried to ask her teacher, Mrs. Johnson, she was busy helping another student. Meanwhile, Tom, a rookie hiker, decided to tackle a familiar trail by himself, eager to enjoy the solitude.

As Gina waited for Mrs. Johnson, she overheard her classmates discussing the new desk. They all seemed to want one, but Gina hadn't realized she wasn't the only one. Tom, on the other hand, was having a great time on his hike, taking in the breathtaking views and enjoying the peaceful atmosphere.

But as the sun began to set, Tom lost track of time. The darkness crept in, and he found himself disoriented and lost. Everything looked different at night, and he couldn't find his way back. Gina, still waiting for Mrs. Johnson, finally realized she had to take matters into her own hands. If she didn't ask first, she wouldn't get that new desk.

With newfound determination, Gina approached Mrs. Johnson and asked about the possibility of getting a new desk. To her surprise, Mrs. Johnson agreed, and Gina was overjoyed. Meanwhile, Tom, using the north star to guide him, finally found his way back home, exhausted but grateful for the adventure.

As Gina settled into her new desk, she felt a sense of accomplishment, knowing she had taken a chance and asked for what she wanted. Tom, too, felt a sense of pride, having navigated the darkness and found his way back home. Both Gina and Tom had learned valuable lessons about perseverance and taking control of their own desires.

responses:
Ted was stressing out about his upcoming finals. He knew he hadn't studied enough this semester and was worried about his grades. Meanwhile, Sally and Tommy were watching TV and saw a family of Syrian refugees on the news. They were deeply moved by their story and felt sad and helpless.

As Ted stayed up late all week studying, Sally and Tommy decided to take action. They wanted to help others, just like the Syrian family they had seen on TV. So, they came up with the idea to have a lemonade stand on Saturday to raise money for a local charity.

On test day, Ted was so exhausted from lack of sleep that he slept all day. He didn't even bother to take his exams. When he finally woke up, he realized he had failed all his tests and would have to retake all his classes.

Sally and Tommy, on the other hand, were busy running their lemonade stand. They sold cups of lemonade all day and managed to raise an impressive $52. As they counted their earnings, they felt proud of what they had accomplished and happy that they could make a difference in their community.

Despite Ted's disappointing results, Sally and Tommy's lemonade stand had brought them a sense of fulfillment and purpose. They had learned that even small actions could make a big impact, and they felt grateful to have been able to help others.

outline: Kim had an online diary that she wrote in daily.

responses:
Kim had always been a candid person, and her online diary was no exception. She wrote in it daily, pouring out her thoughts and feelings onto the digital page. Ruth, her friend, had been invited to a bible study at her neighbor's house and was hesitant to attend, but eventually agreed.

One day, Kim was particularly upset with her boss and wrote a scathing post about the encounter. Ruth and her neighbor gathered around the table, sipping coffee and tea, as they read through several passages from the Bible. They discussed the meaning and significance of each passage, and Kim's post was still fresh in her mind.

But as they delved deeper into their study, Kim suddenly realized her mistake. She wasn't writing in her diary, but on Facebook! Her post was public, and anyone could see it. Panic set in as she thought about the consequences of her actions.

The next day, Kim was summoned to her boss's office and was promptly fired. It seemed that her post had been seen by the wrong people, and her employer had received several complaints. Kim was devastated, and Ruth was shocked by the turn of events.

As the bible study came to a close, Ruth packed up her things and headed home, still reeling from the events of the day. She couldn't believe that Kim's careless post had led to such drastic consequences. As she walked, she couldn't help but wonder what other secrets Kim had shared online, and whether she would ever learn to be more careful with her digital footprint.

But Bobby's bright orange fingers were a bit of a giveaway. His mother, who had been watching from the kitchen window, was not pleased.

As the day came to a close, Julie counted her earnings and was thrilled to find she had made a whopping 100 dollars. She had exceeded her expectations and was already planning her next move. Bobby, on the other hand, was left to ponder the consequences of his cheesy snack.

outline: Lucy was eating in the dark.

Lucy left the bones and the crumbs on the table.
Kim felt a horrible tingling and burning.
The next day Lucy's grandma scolded Lucy for leaving a mess.
Kim was allergic to the gloss!
responses:
Lucy sat alone in the dark, her plate of cold chicken in front of her. She had lost her appetite, and the darkness seemed to match her mood. She was depressed, and the thought of eating was too much to bear. But she forced herself to take a few bites, the dry, tasteless chicken sticking to her tongue.

Meanwhile, Kim was getting ready for bed. She had just applied a new lip gloss, one that promised to make her lips feel moist and soft. She slathered it on, rubbing her lips together to spread the gloss evenly. At first, it felt nice, but soon she began to feel a horrible tingling and burning sensation.

The next day, Lucy's grandma scolded her for leaving a mess on the table. Lucy had eaten the cold chicken and then gone to bed, leaving the bones and crumbs behind. Lucy felt a pang of guilt, but she didn't have the energy to clean up.

Kim, on the other hand, was still dealing with the aftermath of the lip gloss. She had discovered that she was allergic to it, and her lips were still burning and tingling. She wished she had read the warning label more carefully before applying the gloss.

As the day went on, Lucy's depression only deepened. She felt like she was stuck in a rut, and she didn't know how to get out. Kim, meanwhile, was trying to find a way to soothe her allergic reaction. She applied a cold compress to her lips and took an antihistamine, hoping to alleviate the discomfort.

Despite their struggles, both Lucy and Kim were grateful for the small comforts in their lives. Lucy was grateful for her grandma's scolding, which had forced her to confront her mess. Kim was grateful for the cold compress, which had brought some relief to her burning lips. As they drifted off to sleep, they both knew that they would face another day, and that they would find a way to overcome their challenges.

Holly had always dreamed of pursuing a Master's in Public Health, and she worked tirelessly to maintain a good grade point average throughout her undergraduate studies. Emma was devastated and felt her heart was shattered into a million pieces. She confided in Holly, who listened with empathy and understanding. However, Holly was too focused on her academic goals to offer much comfort. Emma, still reeling from the rejection, decided to take matters into her own hands and reported Paul's alleged mistreatment to the authorities.

The authorities, however, didn't take Emma's claims seriously, and she felt even more dejected and humiliated. Holly, on the other hand, continued to excel academically and professionally. As Holly's senior year drew to a close, she was finally able to apply to graduate schools. Her impressive academic record and internship experience earned her a spot in the program she had always wanted. Emma, still nursing her broken heart, began to exhibit unusual behavior, including walking under a mattress for a year to show everyone her feelings.

Despite Emma's antics, Holly remained focused on her goals and began her Master's program in Public Health. As she delved deeper into her studies, she realized that her passion for the field was only matched by her determination to succeed. Emma, on the other hand, slowly began to heal and move on from her past heartache.

Tom had been thinking about buying a gun for a while, and finally decided to take the plunge. He figured it would be a good place to learn about guns, so he headed to the local shooting range. As he was getting ready to shoot, he noticed a guy with hair styled like his favorite singer. Tom couldn't help but stare, and the guy, Stan, caught his eye.

Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance, and he struck up a conversation with Tom. As they talked, Tom mentioned his plans to buy a gun, and Stan seemed interested. Tom was surprised, as most people he talked to were idiots, but Stan seemed different.

Just then, news broke on the radio about the popular singer being involved in an embarrassing scandal. Tom couldn't believe it, and Stan looked crestfallen. As they left the shooting range, Tom couldn't help but think that maybe he didn't need a gun after all. Stan, on the other hand, was lost in thought.

As they walked, Stan caught a glimpse of himself in a mirror and couldn't help but stare. He looked at himself with a critical eye, and for the first time, he didn't like what he saw. It made Tom rethink his own gun culture, and he started to wonder if it was really worth it.

Stan, still lost in thought, pulled out a razor and began to shave off his hair. Tom watched in amazement as Stan's transformation took place before his eyes. When Stan was finished, he looked at himself in the mirror again, and this time, he saw a completely different person. Tom realized that sometimes, it takes a little bit of self-reflection to change your perspective, and he decided to put his plans to buy a gun on hold.

outline: Lagertha didn't like being told what to do.

responses:
Lagertha was a free spirit who didn't like being told what to do. Her mother, however, had other plans. She told Lagertha to clean her room, but Lagertha refused, opting instead to go outside and play with her friends.

Meanwhile, Cody, a classmate of Lagertha's, was struggling with his own issue. His skin, which had always been nice until he was about 8 years old, had started to itch and peel. The pain was becoming unbearable, and his parents were at a loss for what to do.

As the days went by, Cody's condition only worsened. His skin would crack and ooze, causing him immense discomfort. His parents took him to see a doctor, who ran a series of tests and finally diagnosed Cody with eczema.

The doctor prescribed special lotions and creams to help soothe Cody's skin, and slowly but surely, his condition began to improve. But Lagertha's mother was not pleased with her daughter's disobedience, and forbade her from having any treats or fun activities. Lagertha was sent to her room, where she sulked and plotted her next move.

That evening, Lagertha's mother surprised her with a special treat - candy and roast lamb - as a reward for cleaning her room. Lagertha was thrilled, but her joy was short-lived. She knew that her mother would be watching her closely, waiting for her to slip up again.

As the days turned into weeks, Cody's skin continued to improve, thanks to his new treatment. He was finally able to play with his friends without worrying about his skin flaking off. And Lagertha, though still a bit rebellious, learned to appreciate the value of listening to her mother and following the rules.

As Gina continued to help with the packing, she thought about Eddy's question to his mom about clowns having big feet. As the hours passed, Gina's mom asked her to take a break and get some fresh air. Gina agreed, and as she stepped outside, she saw Eddy walking down the street with his mom. She waved at him, and he came over to chat. Gina told him about her mom's packing, and Eddy mentioned the clown's feet again. Gina laughed and shared her mom's explanation about the big shoes. As Gina returned to the packing, she felt grateful for the simple pleasures in life. She was happy to be helping her mom, and she was looking forward to the trip to Minnesota. And who knows, maybe she'd even see a clown or two along the way.

outline: Nellie fell asleep on the sand at the beach.

Nellie's little brother had buried Nellie in sand while Nellie slept!

responses:
Nellie had spent the morning soaking up the sun at the beach, and as the afternoon wore on, she grew tired and decided to take a nap. She settled into the sand, and before she knew it, she was fast asleep.

Meanwhile, on the nearby basketball court, a group of kids were engaged in a heated game. Charles, a seasoned player in his early forties, was dominating the court with his impressive skills. He was about twenty years older than the kids on the court, but his experience and agility made him a force to be reckoned with.

As Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours, her little brother, who had been watching the game, grew bored and decided to have some fun. He snuck up behind Nellie and began to cover her head-to-toe in heavy, wet sand. Nellie was completely unaware of what was happening, and by the time she woke up, she was buried under a mountain of sand.

Panicked, Nellie tried to free herself, but it was no use. She was stuck, and her brother was nowhere to be found. Just as she was starting to lose hope, she heard the sound of a basketball bouncing on the court. The kids were still playing, and Charles was about to make a move that would change the game.

The score was tied, and Charles' team needed one basket to win. He dribbled the ball, faked out his opponents, and then sank a jump shot, securing the win for his team. As the kids cheered, Nellie's brother emerged from behind a nearby dune, a mischievous grin spreading across his face.

Nellie was still stuck in the sand, but she couldn't help but laugh at the absurdity of it all. Charles, noticing her predicament, pretended to be nervous and then walked over to help her out. Together, they managed to free Nellie from her sandy tomb, and she was finally able to join her brother in the fun. Despite the chaos, it was a day that neither Nellie nor Charles would ever forget.

outline: Last summer was incredibly hot.

Last summer was incredibly hot, and Tim was trying to wash dishes in his sweltering kitchen. His friend Dalton, who had spent almost the whole summer holed up in his own house, had come over for a visit. Just then, Dalton burst in, looking frazzled and sweaty. "My air conditioner just broke," he exclaimed. "I've been stuck in my house all day, and it's been a nightmare." Tim sympathized, and the two friends decided to spend the rest of the day at Tim's house, where the air was at least tolerable.

As they sat on the couch, trying to cool off, Tim couldn't help but notice the clogged sink again. He decided to take matters into his own hands and grabbed a plunger from under the sink. After a bit of trying, the water started to leave the sink, and Tim breathed a sigh of relief.

As they sat there, enjoying the relative coolness of Tim's house, Dalton mentioned that he wished his air conditioner had broken more often. "Just think of all the time I could've spent at your house," he joked. Tim chuckled and plunged a bit more just to make sure the sink was fully unclogged. Despite the heat, it had been a pleasant day, and Tim was grateful for the unexpected visit from his friend.

After a long day of physical labor, Charles decided to wash his hands as soon as he got home. He scrubbed them thoroughly with soap and warm water, making sure to remove every last speck of dirt.

Meanwhile, Frank was struggling to come to terms with his injury. He was scared that he would never be able to pitch again, and the thought of giving up the sport he loved was unbearable. But as the months passed, Frank began to make progress in his rehabilitation. He worked tirelessly to rebuild his strength and endurance, and eventually, the day came when he was cleared to return to the mound.

As Frank took the field for the first time in over a year and a half, he felt a mix of emotions: excitement, nervousness, and a hint of uncertainty. But as he began to pitch, he realized that his hard work had paid off. His fastball was still fast, his curveball was still sharp, and his control was still precise.

After the game, Charles was thrilled to see his friend back on the mound, looking stronger and more confident than ever. He was glad he had washed his hands that day, not just because they were clean, but because it reminded him of the importance of perseverance and determination. As Frank celebrated his successful return to the game, Charles knew that he had played a small part in his friend's journey back to the top.

Sarah, still gazing out the window, felt a sense of calm wash over her. She was a peaceful person, and the winter scenery only added to her serenity. As the snow continued to fall, she felt grateful for this time of year, and the simple joys it brought her.

In the end, Tim's discovery of his beloved football had turned his day around, and Sarah's peaceful nature had been reinforced. Despite their different experiences, they both found solace in the quiet beauty of the winter season.

Lisa had always been a responsible pet owner, and her house cat Ruffles was no exception. Ruffles was a gentle soul who had never ventured beyond the confines of their home. Gina, on the other hand, had always been fascinated by the circus. She had spent countless hours watching trapeze artists swing and soar through the air, and she had always dreamed of joining their ranks. The trapeze was her real goal, the one thing she longed to master more than anything else.

One day, Ruffles surprised Lisa by suddenly wanting to go outside. Lisa was taken aback, but she quickly caught Ruffles in time, preventing her from making a break for it. Meanwhile, Gina had been browsing through a local flyer when she stumbled upon an ad for trapeze lessons. She couldn't believe her eyes - this was her chance to finally pursue her lifelong dream!

Without hesitation, Gina signed up for the lessons and couldn't wait for class to begin. She spent the next few days counting down the hours until she could finally get her hands on the trapeze bar.

But just as Gina was about to head out the door for her first lesson, disaster struck. Ruffles had managed to slip out of the house while Lisa was distracted, and was now making a beeline for the great outdoors. Luckily, Lisa was hot on her heels, and she managed to catch Ruffles just in time.

Gina was relieved that her trapeze lessons hadn't been ruined, and she set off for the studio with renewed enthusiasm. As she swung and soared through the air, she felt a sense of freedom and joy that she had never experienced before. She had waited her whole life for this moment, and it was everything she had hoped for and more.

The authorities never found the money, and I was left to wonder what could have been. Looking back, I sort of wish Dalton's air conditioner had broken more often, maybe then I would have been forced to take a break from my embezzlement scheme and think about the consequences of my actions. Ray, a fashion industry professional, was known for his impeccable style. Every season, he needed a new suit to stay ahead of the curve. Last autumn, he had taken a risk and worn a radical-looking suit to work, and to his surprise, it started a new trend altogether.

Meanwhile, Gina, a student in a different class, was obsessed with a brand new desk that the new boy in her class had brought to school. She wanted one just like it, but was too shy to ask her teacher. As she waited for her turn to ask for help, she overheard her classmates discussing the new desk and realized she wasn't the only one who coveted it.

Gina decided to take a chance and ask her teacher, but as she approached, she noticed Ray walking into the classroom, looking dashing in his new suit. She was taken aback by his bold fashion choice, but it also gave her the confidence to ask her teacher for the desk.

As it turned out, Gina's teacher was impressed by her boldness and granted her request. Gina was thrilled to have her new desk, and Ray's fashion sense had inadvertently inspired her to take a risk. From that day on, Gina and Ray became unlikely friends, bonding over their shared love of fashion and taking risks.

outline: Randy was eating his favorite steak.
Phil had always wanted to see Ireland for himself.
While eating Randy felt a pain in his chest.
Phil saved up money for a big trip.
Randy grabbed his chest and fell to the floor.

Randy's kids came over to check on Randy.
Phil tried the local food and met many people.
They rushed Randy to the hospital where Randy made a full recovery.
Phil was happy that Phil had finally visited Ireland.
responses:
Randy sat at the dinner table, savoring his favorite steak. Phil, his friend, had always wanted to visit Ireland, and Randy was happy to hear about his plans. As Randy took another bite, he suddenly felt a sharp pain in his chest. He grabbed his chest and fell to the floor, his steak forgotten.

Phil rushed to Randy's side, concerned for his friend's well-being. Randy's kids arrived soon after, and they quickly called for an ambulance. Randy was rushed to the hospital, where doctors worked to stabilize his condition.

Meanwhile, Phil had finally saved up enough money for his big trip to Ireland. He was thrilled to be able to fulfill his lifelong dream. After months of planning, the day had finally arrived, and Phil boarded a flight to Dublin.

In Ireland, Phil tried all sorts of local foods and drinks, and met many friendly people along the way. He explored the countryside, marveling at the stunning landscapes and rich history.

Back at the hospital, Randy made a full recovery, much to the relief of his family and friends. Phil, still in Ireland, received the news and was overjoyed to hear that his friend was on the mend.

When Phil returned from his trip, he was happy to share stories of his adventures in Ireland with Randy, who was grateful to be back on his feet. Despite the unexpected turn of events, both friends were grateful for the unexpected detour that had brought them closer together.

outline: Tim was allergic to peanuts.
Bryan is in the third grade.
Tim was out eating at a restaurant.
Bryan does not listen to his parents.
Tim asked them if there were any in Tim's food.
Since Bryan always refuses to do his homework Bryan is behind in school.
They told Tim there wasn't but Tim still had an allergic reaction.
Bryan now has to go to a tutor every night.
Tim is now suing the restaurant for medical costs.
Bryan has now learned how to do Bryan's math.
responses:
Tim was out eating at a restaurant, enjoying a nice evening out. He had asked the waiter if there were any peanuts in his food, as he was severely allergic. The waiter assured him that there weren't, but unbeknownst to Tim, the chef had accidentally added peanuts to his dish.

As Tim took a bite, he began to feel his throat constricting and his skin breaking out in hives. He quickly realized that he had indeed ingested peanuts and was having an allergic reaction. The restaurant staff rushed him to the hospital, where he received treatment for his severe allergic reaction.

Meanwhile, Bryan, a third-grader, was struggling in school. He always refused to do his homework, and as a result, he was falling behind his peers. His parents were at their wit's end, trying to get him to focus and catch up on his schoolwork.

In an effort to help Bryan, his parents decided to hire a tutor to work with him every night. At first, Bryan was resistant to the idea, but eventually, he began to see the benefits of having a tutor. With the tutor's help, Bryan was finally able to catch up on his schoolwork and even started to excel in math.

As for Tim, he was left with a hefty medical bill from his allergic reaction. He decided to sue the restaurant for the costs, citing negligence on their part for not properly labeling the peanuts in his food.

In the end, both Tim and Bryan learned valuable lessons. Tim learned the importance of double-checking his food for allergens, and Bryan learned the value of hard work and dedication.

outline: Gina prepared food for the family.

Gina cooked lasagna, grilled chicken and garlic bread.
Bobby poured ketchup from the dispenser.
As soon as we started to eat, Gina's mom became nauseous.
The ketchup was rancid.
Afterwards, everyone started to feel queasy.
Bobby threw the ketchup away.
Gina eventually threw away the food and ordered Chinese food.
Bobby went up to the counter and asked for ketchup packets.
responses:
Gina had spent the afternoon cooking up a storm in the kitchen, preparing a delicious meal for the family. She had made a classic lasagna, grilled some juicy chicken, and even thrown together some garlic bread for good measure. As the family gathered around the table, Bobby, who had been out running errands, walked in the door and headed straight for the fast food restaurant down the street.

Meanwhile, Gina's mom, who had been looking forward to the meal all day, took a bite of the lasagna and suddenly felt a wave of nausea wash over her. Gina was taken aback, wondering what could be wrong. That's when she noticed Bobby, who had stopped by the fast food restaurant on his way home, pouring ketchup from the dispenser into his container.

It wasn't until later, when everyone had started to feel queasy, that they discovered the source of the problem. The ketchup was rancid, and it had been contaminated with something that was making everyone sick. Bobby, feeling guilty, quickly threw the ketchup away, but it was too late. The damage had already been done.

Gina, determined to salvage the evening, decided to throw away the rest of the food and order some Chinese takeout instead. As they waited for the food to arrive, Bobby went up to the counter and asked for ketchup packets, hoping to make up for his mistake. In the end, the family was able to enjoy a delicious and ketchup-free meal, and they all learned a valuable lesson about the importance of checking expiration dates.

outline: Kim's lips felt dry.

Bill embezzled a large amount of money from the bank.

Bank auditors discovered the discrepancy.
Kim felt a horrible tingling and burning.
Bill was convicted and sent to prison.
Kim was allergic to the gloss!
The authorities never found Bill's money.
responses:
Kim's lips felt dry, so she decided to try out a new lip gloss that promised to make her lips moist. She slathered it on and rubbed her lips together, feeling a temporary relief from the dryness. Meanwhile, Bill, her partner, worked at a bank as a loan officer. Unbeknownst to anyone, Bill had a secret: he had been embezzling a large amount of money from the bank.

But Kim's relief from the lip gloss was short-lived. As the day went on, she started to feel a horrible tingling and burning sensation on her lips. She tried to ignore it, but it only got worse. It wasn't until she looked in the mirror that she realized the horrifying truth: she was allergic to the lip gloss!

As Bill's embezzlement was discovered by bank auditors, he was convicted and sent to prison. Kim, still reeling from her allergic reaction, couldn't help but wonder if her partner's troubles were somehow connected to her own lip woes. But the authorities never found Bill's stolen money, and Kim was left to deal with the aftermath of her allergic reaction, her dry lips now a distant memory.

outline: Marissa is turning 16 this year.

John's grades improved.

Marissa was turning 16 this year, and her parents were planning a surprise sweet 16 party for her. Meanwhile, John, a classmate of Marissa's, was struggling in school. He wanted to do well, but his grades were suffering. Desperate for help, John hired a tutor to assist him.

As John's tutor worked with him, he began to see significant improvements in his grades. His hard work and the tutor's guidance paid off, and John's grades began to soar. Marissa's parents, unaware of John's struggles, were busy planning her party, which would be held at their house.

On the day of the party, Marissa's parents surprised her with a bash she would never forget. The house was filled with friends, food, and music, and Marissa was in shock. She had no idea her parents had been planning such a big celebration for her.

As the party raged on, John made an appearance, beaming with pride. He had worked hard to improve his grades, and it had paid off. Marissa was thrilled to see her friend doing so well, and the two of them danced the night away, surrounded by their friends and family.

In the end, the party was a huge success, and Marissa was overjoyed. John's grades had improved, and he had found a new sense of confidence. As they looked back on the night, they both knew that it was a celebration they would never forget.

outline: Dina is getting married in two weeks.
Bobby got into the cheese puffs.
Dina's friend Colleen is serving as Dina's maid of honor.
Bobby's mother told Bobby to wait until after dinner, but Bobby couldn't.
Dina is getting a little bit nervous as the date approaches.
Bobby thought Bobby'd gotten away with it.
Colleen is helping calm Dina's fears by being supportive.
Then Bobby realized Bobby had bright orange cheese all over Bobby's fingers.
Dina hopes Dina is not so nervous on the actual day of the wedding.
Bobby's mother didn't let Bobby have dessert that night as punishment.
responses:
Dina was getting married in just two weeks, and she was starting to feel the pressure. Her friend Colleen, who was serving as her maid of honor, could sense her friend's growing anxiety and did her best to calm her down.

Meanwhile, Bobby, Dina's fiancé, had gotten into a bag of cheese puffs earlier that day. His mother had told him to wait until after dinner, but Bobby just couldn't resist the salty snack. He thought he'd gotten away with it, but little did he know, his fate was about to take a dramatic turn.

As the evening wore on, Dina began to feel a little more at ease thanks to Colleen's support. But Bobby, still snacking on the cheese puffs, didn't notice the bright orange stains spreading across his fingers.

It wasn't until he went to wash his hands before dinner that Bobby realized his mistake. His fingers were covered in cheese puffs dust, and he couldn't get the stains out. He felt a wave of panic wash over him as he thought about the impending wedding and the embarrassment he might face.

Dina, sensing Bobby's distress, asked him what was wrong. Bobby tried to brush it off, but Dina could tell something was amiss. She gently coaxed the truth out of him, and together they laughed about the mishap.

As the night drew to a close, Bobby's mother punished him by withholding dessert, a small price to pay for the lesson he'd learned. Dina, feeling more at peace, hoped that she wouldn't be as nervous on the actual day of the wedding. With Colleen by her side, she knew she could face anything that came her way.

outline: Sarah always wanted to have a pet cat.
Katie's mom had twins when Katie was four.
Sarah's mom knew Sarah was too young for Sarah's own pet.
At first Katie hated the twins!
Instead of a cat, Sarah's mom bought Sarah a goldfish.
Katie was always being asked to help out.
Sarah named Sarah's fish Cat.
Katie felt abandoned.
It looks like Sarah got a pet Cat after all.
But soon enough, Katie grew to love her baby sisters!
responses:
Sarah had always dreamed of having a pet cat. She would spend hours playing with her friends' cats and begging her mom for one of her own. But her mom knew Sarah was still too young to care for a pet, so she gently declined her requests.

Meanwhile, Katie's mom had a surprise for her - twins! Katie was only four years old when her mom brought home the new additions to the family. At first, Katie was not thrilled about the new arrivals and felt like her mom was abandoning her.

Sarah, on the other hand, was still hoping to get a pet. Her mom, knowing Sarah was still too young, decided to compromise and bought her a goldfish instead. Sarah was overjoyed and named the fish Cat, much to her mom's amusement.

As time went on, Katie found herself being asked to help out with her new baby sisters more and more. She started to feel like she was being left out and abandoned by her mom. Sarah, on the other hand, was thrilled to have a new "pet" to care for and spent hours watching Cat swim around its tank.

But as Katie grew closer to her baby sisters, she began to realize that they were actually pretty cool. She started to enjoy helping her mom take care of them and even grew to love them. It looked like Sarah had finally gotten her pet Cat after all - but this time, it was her sister!

In the end, Sarah's mom was happy to see her daughters getting along and forming a special bond. And Sarah learned that sometimes, the best pets are the ones that come in the form of a new sibling.

outline: Adam was expecting an important phone call.
Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
Adam carried Adam's phone with Adam all day.
Sam thought it was the grossest thing Sam ever saw.
Adam was surprised in the evening nobody called.
Barry told Sam to try it himself, but Sam refused.
Adam checked Adam's phone.
After many weeks, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.
It was on silent mode.
Sam now eats peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week.
responses:
Adam was pacing back and forth in his living room, expecting an important phone call that was supposed to come in earlier that day. He had his phone clutched tightly in his hand, checking it every few minutes to see if he had missed the call. Meanwhile, his brother Barry was in the kitchen, making himself a peanut butter and banana sandwich.

Sam, who was visiting from out of town, walked into the kitchen and was immediately hit with the pungent aroma of the sandwich. He looked over and saw Barry happily munching away, and his face contorted in disgust. "Gross!" Sam exclaimed, covering his nose. "What is that abomination you're eating?"

Barry chuckled and offered Sam a bite, but Sam refused, holding his nose in distaste. Adam, still waiting for his phone call, didn't notice the commotion in the kitchen.

As the evening wore on, Adam grew more and more anxious, but the phone remained silent. He checked it repeatedly, but there were no missed calls or messages. Finally, he gave up and put the phone down, deciding to focus on his evening instead.

Later that night, Barry was still snacking on his sandwich, and Sam was sitting on the couch, flipping through TV channels. Barry, still eating, suddenly had an idea. "Hey, Sam, you should try a bite," he said, holding out the sandwich.

Sam hesitated, but Barry's persistence eventually wore him down. He took a small bite, and to his surprise, it wasn't as bad as he thought it would be. In fact, it was kind of...good. Barry grinned triumphantly, and Sam admitted that maybe he had been wrong about the sandwich.

The next day, Adam checked his phone again, still expecting that important call. But as he scrolled through his messages, he noticed that his phone had been on silent mode the entire time. He shook his head, chuckling at his own forgetfulness.

As the weeks went by, Sam found himself craving the peanut butter and banana sandwich more and more. He would often stop by Barry's place and beg him to make one, and eventually, Barry started making them for him every week. Sam had come full circle, from grossed-out to converted, and he had Barry to thank for it.

outline: Sally and Tommy saw a family of Syrian refugees on TV.
Sarah loves the winter.
Sally and Tommy were sad and wanted to help.
One of Sarah's favorite things about this time is the trees.
Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand.
Sarah loves watching the snow pile on the branches.
Sally and Tommy sold lemonade all day Saturday.
Sarah stared out the window all winter.
Tommy and Sally felt glad Tommy and Sally raised fifty two dollars.
Sarah is a peaceful person because of it.
responses:
Sally and Tommy sat on the couch, watching TV with their mom. They saw a family of Syrian refugees on the news, and their faces fell. They were sad and wanted to help. Sally, who loved the winter, gazed out the window at the bare trees, her favorite part of the season. She loved watching the snow pile on the branches, making them look like they were wearing white hats.

The next day, Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand to raise money for the refugees. They set up their stand in front of their house and sold lemonade all day Saturday. As the sun began to set, they counted their earnings and were thrilled to see they had raised fifty-two dollars.

Sarah, who had been staring out the window all winter, smiled for the first time in months. She was a peaceful person, and the thought of helping others brought her joy. Sally and Tommy felt glad they had made a difference, and they knew that their small act of kindness would have a big impact on the refugees' lives. As they went to bed that night, they felt proud of themselves and already started making plans for their next fundraising adventure.

outline: Tim woke up early one day.
Tina had a paper due in two hours.
Tim decided to eat cereal before work.
Only problem was Tina did not start it yet.
After taking a bite Tim realized it was stale.
Tina then worked very hard for those two hours.
Tim decided Tim didn't care.
To Tina's delight Tina got a great grade in the end.
Tim kept eating it after it soaked in the milk a bit.
Tina could not believe it.
responses:
Tim woke up early one day, feeling refreshed and ready to tackle the day. As he got dressed, he noticed that his sister Tina was still asleep, and he could hear her gentle snores coming from her room. He decided to make himself a bowl of cereal before heading to work, hoping to get a quick energy boost.

As he poured the cereal into the bowl, he noticed that it was still in its box, untouched. He called out to Tina, "Hey, did you start the cereal?" But there was no response. He shrugged and took a bite, expecting the usual crunchy texture. But to his surprise, the cereal was stale.

Tim was about to spit it out when he heard Tina's alarm clock go off. She was getting ready for a big exam, and she had only two hours to finish her paper. Tim decided to let it go and not bother her about the stale cereal. After all, it was just a small thing.

Tina worked tirelessly for the next two hours, pouring her heart and soul into her paper. Tim could hear her typing away, and he was impressed by her dedication. When she finally finished, she let out a sigh of relief and smiled, knowing she had done her best.

As Tim headed out the door to work, he couldn't help but think about the stale cereal. He decided to keep eating it, hoping that the milk would make it taste better. And to his surprise, it did. The milk soaked into the cereal, making it slightly more palatable.

When Tina came downstairs, she was thrilled to hear that she had gotten a great grade on her paper. She was beaming with pride, and Tim couldn't help but feel happy for her. But when she saw the bowl of cereal in front of him, she couldn't believe her eyes.

"Tim, how could you eat that stale cereal?" she asked, her voice filled with disgust. Tim just shrugged and smiled, "Hey, it's not that bad. And it's not like it's going to kill me." Tina just rolled her eyes and shook her head, laughing at her brother's antics. Despite the stale cereal, it had been a good day, and they both knew it.

outline: Tom thought about his health often.

Tom would wash Tom's hands 30 times per day.
Kelly decided to ask the boy out one day.
Tom visited a psychologist about this.
The boy told Kelly that he wasn't interested, but the boy was just shy.
The psychologist helped Tom significantly.
After a week the boy told Kelly the truth and the boy went out.
Tom no longer washed Tom's hands excessively.
Kelly and the boy are now dating and Kelly and the boy are both happy.
responses:
Tom had always been a worrier, and his health was no exception. He would often find himself lost in thought, fretting about every little ache and pain. His friends and family had grown accustomed to his concerns, but Tom couldn't shake the feeling that something was off.

Meanwhile, Kelly had developed a crush on the boy who sat next to her in class. She would catch herself stealing glances at him during lessons, and her heart would skip a beat. One day, she decided to take a chance and ask him out. To her surprise, he agreed, but only to tell her that he wasn't interested. Kelly was devastated, but she couldn't help but wonder if there was more to his rejection than met the eye.

Tom, still preoccupied with his health, had begun to visit a psychologist to work through his anxieties. The sessions were helping, and he was starting to feel more grounded and centered. Kelly, still reeling from her rejection, confided in Tom about her experience. Tom listened attentively, offering words of encouragement and support.

As the days went by, Kelly couldn't help but notice that the boy who had rejected her was acting strangely. He would often blush and fumble his words when she was around, and Kelly began to suspect that he might be shy rather than disinterested. She decided to give him another chance, and to her delight, he agreed to go out with her.

Tom, now feeling more confident and self-assured, had all but stopped washing his hands excessively. He was proud of the progress he had made, and he was grateful to his psychologist for helping him work through his issues. Kelly and the boy, now dating, were both happy and content, and Tom was thrilled to see his friends so in love.

As the weeks went by, Kelly and the boy's relationship continued to blossom. They would often sit together at lunch, holding hands and laughing together. Tom would watch them with a warm heart, grateful to have played a small part in their happiness. And as he looked on, he knew that he had finally found a sense of peace and contentment that he had been searching for all along.

outline: Ben had a huge collection of video games.

Ben's team got knocked out very early.
Eric ran off and hoped that Eric was not being chased.

He had mastered the game, and his team, "The Rocketeers," had entered a prestigious competition. Ben was confident that they would do well, but as the day of the competition approached, he couldn't shake off the feeling of nervousness.

Meanwhile, Eric was hurrying through the city park on his way to a bar, eager to meet his friends for a night out. In his haste, he decided to take a shortcut, hopping over the fence and cutting across the grass. As he ran, he didn't notice the park ranger watching him from a distance.

Ben's team arrived at the competition venue, and Ben was thrilled to see the other teams gathered around the tables. The competition was fierce, and Ben's team tried their best, but unfortunately, they were outmatched by the other teams. They got knocked out very early, and Ben was disappointed but not surprised.

As Eric continued his shortcut, the park ranger spotted him and yelled, "Hey, you! Get back over the fence!" Eric, startled, quickly ran off, hoping that he wasn't being chased. He didn't look back, fearing what might happen if he got caught.

Despite the setbacks, Ben was already planning his next move, determined to improve his team's skills and come back stronger. As for Eric, he made it to the bar, where his friends were waiting, none the wiser to his brief adventure through the park.

outline: Charles was about twenty years older than the kids on the court.

Robbie's parents took Robbie to the Humane Society to choose one.

Robbie and Robbie's parents took the new pet cat home.
responses:
Charles, a seasoned basketball player, stood out on the court, his age of around forty years old making him significantly older than the kids playing alongside him. As he dribbled the ball, Robbie, a young boy with a passion for the game, watched in awe. Robbie's eyes sparkled with excitement as he dreamed of having a pet cat, a desire his parents had finally agreed to fulfill.

The day arrived when Robbie's parents took him to the Humane Society to choose the perfect feline companion. As they walked down the rows of cages, Robbie's eyes scanned the faces of the cats, searching for the purrfect match. As Charles received the ball, he pretended to be nervous, his teammates urging him to take the shot. With a swift motion, Charles sank a jump shot, securing the win for his team. The crowd erupted in cheers, and Robbie, still at the Humane Society, looked up at his parents with a beaming smile.

Finally, after much deliberation, Robbie chose a beautiful black and grey cat, and his parents agreed to take it home. As they left the shelter, Robbie couldn't wait to introduce his new pet to his friends, including Charles, who had just proven his skills on the court. With the cat safely in their care, Robbie and his parents headed home, already envisioning the joyful moments they would share with their new furry family member.

outline: Joe was going to the new restaurant with his coworkers for lunch.
Frank was a pitcher for a MLB team.
Joe sent some discount coupons out to Joe's workplace.
But last season Frank got hurt and had to receive Tommy John surgery.
Joe's coworkers offered some quick and cheap lunch options.
Frank was scared Frank would not pitch again.
It was also very close to Joe's work.
But after a year and a half Frank came back to pitch again.
Joe hoped it would be his new lunch place to go to.
Frank was once again a pitcher for a MLB team.
responses:
Joe was excited to try out the new restaurant with his coworkers for lunch. As they walked in, he noticed a familiar face - Frank, the pitcher for the local MLB team. Joe had sent out some discount coupons to his workplace, hoping to attract some new customers.

But as they sat down to order, Joe couldn't help but notice the scar on Frank's elbow. "What happened?" he asked, curiosity getting the better of him. Frank explained that he had undergone Tommy John surgery the previous season, and was scared he might never pitch again.

Joe's coworkers, however, were more interested in the quick and cheap lunch options on the menu. "Let's just get some sandwiches," one of them suggested. But Joe was determined to try out the new restaurant, and convinced his coworkers to give it a shot.

As they waited for their food, Joe asked Frank more about his injury. Frank told him that it had been a tough road to recovery, but he had worked hard to get back in shape. And to everyone's surprise, he had made it back to the MLB team just a year and a half later.

Joe was thrilled to hear the news, and couldn't wait to try out the new restaurant again. It was conveniently located just a block away from his work, making it the perfect spot for a quick lunch. And as they finished up their meal, Joe turned to his coworkers and said, "I think this is going to be my new go-to lunch spot."

Frank, who was sitting across from them, smiled and nodded in agreement. "I'm glad to hear that," he said. "And who knows, maybe I'll even make it out to the restaurant again sometime." With that, the group finished up their lunch and headed back to work, already looking forward to their next meal at the new restaurant.

outline: Tim was trying to wash dishes.

Ray knew his mom had a new interest in fitness and exercise.
Tim tried using a plunger to fix it.
Ray asked a fitness instructor and the instructor recommended Fitbit.
After a bit of trying the water started to leave.

Tim plunged a bit more just to make sure.
Ray's mom was really surprised and happy with the Fitbit Ray bought.

Tim was stuck at the sink, trying to wash the dishes, but the water just wouldn't drain. He was getting frustrated, wondering what was causing the clog. Meanwhile, Ray was wandering around the house, trying to come up with the perfect birthday present for his mom. She had recently developed a new interest in fitness and exercise, and he wanted to get her something that would help her achieve her goals.

As Tim continued to struggle with the clogged sink, he noticed that the water was still refusing to drain. He decided to try using a plunger to fix the problem. After a few minutes of plunging, he finally felt the water start to leave the sink. Relieved, he put the plunger down and went to find Ray.

Ray was still searching for the perfect gift, and Tim suggested he ask a fitness instructor for advice. Ray took Tim's suggestion and headed out to find an instructor. After a quick consultation, the instructor recommended a Fitbit, a popular fitness tracker that would help Ray's mom track her progress and stay motivated.

Ray was excited to get the Fitbit, and he headed out to buy it. When he returned home, he presented it to his mom, who was thrilled with the thoughtful gift. She was really surprised and happy with the Fitbit, and Ray was relieved that he had found the perfect present.

As Tim was finishing up the dishes, he noticed that the water was still a bit slow to drain. He decided to plunge a bit more just to make sure, and then he was done. Ray's mom was enjoying her new Fitbit, and everyone was happy with the outcome.

outline: Robbie wanted a pet cat.
Eric referees high school football.
Robbie's parents took Robbie to the Humane Society to choose one.
Every Friday, there is a new game and a new experience.
Robbie looked at all of the cats in the cages.
This Friday, the top two teams in the state are playing.
Finally, Robbie chose a black and grey cat.
Everyone is abuzz about the game.
Robbie and Robbie's parents took the new pet cat home.
Eric can not wait to referee the game.
responses:
Robbie had been begging his parents for a pet cat for what felt like forever. Finally, they relented and took him to the Humane Society to choose one. As they walked through the rows of cages, Robbie's eyes scanned the furry faces, searching for the perfect companion.

Every Friday, Eric, Robbie's dad, refereed high school football games, and this Friday was no exception. The top two teams in the state were facing off, and everyone was abuzz about the game. But Robbie's mind was on the cats.

After what felt like hours, Robbie finally found the one. A sleek black and grey cat with piercing green eyes caught his attention. He tugged on his mom's hand, begging her to let him take the cat home. His parents agreed, and they left the Humane Society with their new furry friend.

As they drove home, Robbie couldn't stop talking about his new pet. Eric, who was already getting ready for the big game, chuckled and teased Robbie about his new responsibility. Robbie just grinned, already planning all the fun he would have with his new cat.

When they arrived home, Robbie and his parents set up a cozy little bed for the cat, and Robbie spent the rest of the evening playing with his new companion. As the sun began to set, Robbie's parents headed out to watch Eric referee the big game. Robbie stayed behind, snuggled up with his new cat, already feeling like the luckiest kid in the world.

outline: Mary had a diary which she used to store her personal thoughts.

Mary's brother returned the diary to its hiding spot.
Gina eventually threw away the food and ordered Chinese food.

Mary sat at her desk, scribbling away in her diary. Her brother, trying to be sneaky, slipped into her room, his eyes scanning the space for any sign of what he was looking for. He spotted the diary and his curiosity got the better of him. He opened it, and began to read Mary's private thoughts.

Meanwhile, downstairs, Gina was busy in the kitchen, preparing dinner for the family. She had cooked up a storm, whipping up a delicious lasagna, grilling some juicy chicken, and baking some crispy garlic bread. The aroma wafting from the kitchen was mouthwatering, and everyone's stomachs were growling in anticipation.

Just as they were about to sit down to eat, Gina's mom suddenly felt a wave of nausea wash over her. She excused herself, rushing to the bathroom to try and compose herself. The rest of the family exchanged worried glances, wondering what was wrong.

As they sat down to eat, Mary's brother couldn't shake the feeling of guilt that had settled in his stomach. He knew he had no right to read Mary's diary, and he felt terrible for snooping. He glanced around the table, feeling like he was going to be sick.

But it wasn't just Gina's mom who was feeling queasy. As they started to eat, everyone began to feel a strange, creeping sense of unease. The food, which had smelled so delicious just moments before, now seemed to be sitting heavy in their stomachs.

Mary's brother, feeling a pang of guilt and regret, quickly returned the diary to its hiding spot, hoping to make things right. But it was too late. The damage was done, and the family's dinner was ruined.

Gina, sensing that something was off, quickly threw away the uneaten food and ordered some Chinese takeout instead. As they waited for their new meal to arrive, the family sat in silence, each lost in their own thoughts. Mary's brother knew he had to make things right with his sister, and he vowed to do so as soon as possible.

As Paul was on his way to work, he stopped and got another cup of coffee. Marcus, feeling more refreshed after drinking more water, was already getting ready for his day. Paul and Marcus didn't notice each other's morning mishaps, but they both felt grateful for the chance to start their day over.

Phil, on the other hand, was struggling to keep up with the demands of running the circus. He was exhausted, stressed, and feeling overwhelmed. There were times when he wished he had never bought the place and was still just an employee.

But Gina was undeterred. She signed up for the trapeze lessons and threw herself into the training. She practiced every day, determined to master the art of swinging from the trapeze. And finally, the day arrived when she was ready to perform.

As she swung through the air, her heart full of joy and her spirit soaring, Gina knew that all her hard work had been worth it. She had achieved her dream, and nothing could ever take that away from her.

As the days went by, Phil found himself feeling more energized and motivated. He started to enjoy the challenges of running the circus again, and the place began to flourish under his leadership. The trapeze performances became a huge hit, and the circus was more popular than ever before.

Gina's dream had come true, and in doing so, she had inspired Phil to find his own passion and purpose. The circus was once again a place of wonder and magic, where dreams could come true and anything was possible.
